All Classes

Class Description
Action  
ActionQuestionEvent
Sends to the server the action chosen by the client and performed on the selected worker on the given coordinates
BlockLevelUp
Additional layer other divinities are encapsulated into if Athena moved up in her turn.
BlockSelectionWhenHigher
Additional layer other divinities are wrapped into if Hypnus is in game.
BlockWinOnPerimeter
Additional layer other divinities are encapsulated into if Hera is in game.
Board
Class to manage all the Tiles and to access them.
BoardRepresentation
Representation of the Board on the client side.
BuildBeforeAndAfter
This divinity, Prometheus, is able to build before and after moving only if he does not go up by one level during the same turn.
BuildDomeEverywhere
Atlas is able to build a dome instead of a regular block during his build phase, complying with the basic rules of Worker.build(it.polimi.ingsw.model.Tile)
BuildEvent
Informs a client that the specified player built with the selected worker on the specified tile
BuildTwice
General class to decorate divinities that are able to build twice consecutively.
BuildTwiceNotOnPerimeter
Hestia's workers can build twice but not on the perimeter
BuildTwiceNotSameTile
This Goddess, Demeter, can build twice but not on the same tile.
BuildTwiceSameTile
This God, Hephaestus, can build twice but only on the same tile.
BuildUnderYourself
Zeus can build below himself if he chooses the tile he is occupying.
CannotSelectIfHigher
Hypnus' effect is always active: at the beginning of an opponent's turn, they cannot select a worker if this is on a higher level than the others of the same player.
CannotWinOnPerimeter
Hera prevent the other players from winning if they move onto a perimetral tile
Check5CompleteTowerWinCondition
Decoration to be applied to other players' divinities when Chrono is in game.
CLI
Class for the Command Line Interface.
ClientEvent
Base class that client events inherit.
ClientSocketHandler
ClientSocketHandler manages a client's connection receiving holding an input stream and an output one to receive ServerEvent and to send ClientEvent.
ClientView
This class is the core to manage a player during a game, observing the ServerEvent to update the client and calling the methods to send an event on the ClientSocketHandler.
Color
Enumeration of colors, users can choose from
Controller
The controller is the bridge between the network and the model.
DisconnectionController
Class to manage what to show when a user disconnects.
DisconnectionEvent
Informs the server the will of a client to disconnect
DivinitiesInGameEvent
List of all divinities with their description sent to the last player who will choose as many as the number of players
DivinitiesInGameSelectionEvent
List of divinities that will be playable, picked by the last player alongside the player that will begin the game.
DivinitiesSetupEvent
Informs a client about which divinity each player chose
Divinity
Interface implemented by all the divinities to realize the Decorator Pattern; as such it is passed as a parameter in the classes using a divinity
DivinityDecoratorWithEffects
General class to decorate a divinity with special effects in accordance to Decorator Pattern.
DivinityInitializationEvent
List of divinities chosen by the last player that each user can choose from.
DivinitySelectionController
Class to display and menage the GUI inherent to the selection of the divinities to be selected by the last player.
DivinitySelectionEvent
Tells the server which divinity the player chose.
EndGameController
This controller manages the graphical elements for the end game (there is a winner)
EndTurnEvent
Notifies the client that their turn has ended
GameSetupEvent
Event sent at the start of the game to let the client know the information about every player: the players' username, their color, their divinity and their divinity's description
GameStartEvent
Notifies the client that the game has begun
GUI
This class represents the Graphical User Interface.
InLobbyEvent
Informs the client that they correctly joined a session
InvalidActionException
Exception thrown when a player select an action that should't perform
InvalidBuildEvent
Tells the client that they performed a bad build and sends again the list of possible action through a map: the action and the list of coordinates as a Pair
InvalidBuildException
Thrown when a player chooses to build on a wrong tile
InvalidDivinitySelectionEvent
Thrown when a non available divinity is selected or some of its information is lacking
InvalidMoveEvent
Tells the client that they performed a bad move and sends again the list of possible action through a map: the action and the list of coordinates as a Pair
InvalidMoveException
Thrown when a player chooses to move on a wrong tile
InvalidWorkerPlacementEvent
Sent if the user chose a wrong place for the placement of a worker
InvalidWorkerSelectionEvent
Sent if the client chose a worker that is currently blocked (cannot move).
InvalidWorkerSelectionException
Thrown when a player chooses a worker that can't perform actions
LobbyFullEvent
Event telling a client they connected after the lobby filled
LoginController
Class to manage the GUI for the login.
LoginEvent
Sent when the client connects to the server.
LoserEvent
Event sent to inform a player that they lost
Main
Main class to start a game client side.
Match
Core class of the game logic in the model.
MatchController
Core controller to menage the flow of the game.
Model
Interface implemented by the Match
ModelUpdate
Class comprising information related to the changes happening on the model during the game flow that will change the user interface
MoveAgainIfOnPerimeterSpace
This God, Triton, can move as many times as he wishes if his worker is on a perimetrical tile
MoveEvent
Informs a client that the specified player moved with the selected worker on the specified tile
MoveMultipleTimes
Parent class to realize divinities whose effect is to move twice in the same turn
MoveOnOpponent
Parent class for gods that can move on opponents
MoveTwiceNotBack
This Goddess, Artemis, can move twice but not back to its initial space.
Observable<T>  
Observer<T>  
OpponentCannotMoveUp
Athena prevents other players from moving up during their next turns, if she has moved up.
Pair<T,​V>
Custom class created to easily send packages through the socket
Ping
Verifies that a client is reachable.
PingManager
Class that manages a ping to verify that a client is still active.
PingReceiver
Class to verify that a user is still active.
Player
The class to manage a player, saving his username, his workers' color and his chosen divinity; the class also contains the list of his workers and a set of possible actions changing during the game.
PlayerDisconnectionEvent
Sent to every client after an user disconnected.
PlayerDivinitySelectionController
Class to manage the gui's divinity selection.
PlayerRepresentation
Class to represent a player at the client side.
PlayerWinWith5CompleteBuildings
Chrono wins if someone in the game completes the fifth tower (level 3 plus dome).
Pong
Event to manage the connection between the client and server.
PossibleActionsEvent
List containing the actions a user can select: move, build, builddome, end
PushOpponent
This class represents Minotaur, whose effect is to push an opponent on the direction he is moving, if the tile the opponent is to be occupying is accessible.
Server
Server contains the main to create a server that manages the clients, allowing them to communicate and playing a game.
ServerDisconnectionEvent  
ServerEvent
This class is the parent of all the other client events.
ServerSocketHandler
Helps to manage each client connection, pairing it with the server.
ServerView
Class with a role similar to a proxy that speaks to the client sending events
SetEffectOnOpponent
Parent class for the divinities that can apply an effect on the other players, modifying their move, build or winning condition.
SocketPortEvent  
StandardDivinity
Class that is to be "decorated" with the effects of a defined divinity.
StartTurnEvent
Informs a client that it is their turn.
SwapWithOpponent
When this God, Apollo, moves onto an opponent tile, his worker and the opponent's swap their positions
TextMessageEvent
Text message to tell something to a client
Tile
The tile is equivalent to a cell in an array where in this case, the array is the board.
UI
UI is the interface for the user interface.
UsernameAlreadyUsed
Sent if the user picked an already used username
WelcomeEvent
Event after which a client sends their username.
WinByDropTwoLevel
Pan's player can also win if his worker drops by two level
WinnerEvent
Informs the player that they are the winner
Worker
The worker is the the mean through which a player can perform changes on the model.
WorkerBadPlacementException
Thrown when a player tries to place their workers on an occupied tile
WorkerInitializationEvent
Event to tell the client to place their workers
WorkerPlacementEvent
Tells a user where the specified player placed their workers
WorkerSelectionEvent
Asks the client to select a worker
WorkerSelectionQuestionEvent
Selects the worker that will perform the action specified in the other events.
WorkersPlacementSelectionEvent
Event that tells the model where to place a player's workers.
XMLParserUtility
Parser used to setup the divinities
